intro: Aganosma petelotii, commonly known as the Madagascar aganosma, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments within the rainforest understory. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
